intro: Choritaenia capensis, commonly known as the Cape choralis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to drought conditions with its thick, water-storing tissues. Choritaenia capensis is often found growing in rocky soils and along coastal areas.
